result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Allen C. PETERSON Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and counseling and driver safety plan.
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
under the Huber Law.  
Six (6) months up front, to commence immediately; six (6) months stayed to be imposed at agent's discretion.

Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC and Sheriff

This matter was set for a motion to dismiss hearing today.
Attorney Dewane has made an offer.  In exchange for withdrawing the motion, the State will recommend a withheld sentence and 3 years probation with six months jail.
Defense counsel withdraws the motion to dismiss filed on 07-21-14.
The defendant agrees with the withdrawal of this motion based on the offer made by the State.
The Court deems the motion withdrawn.
Plea date is set for 01-05-15 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI - 4th offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-06-14 at 9:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and that he not operate a motor vehicle.
